page.title: 01Landwade Area
page.content: The area is entirely rural with only a tiny population. Most of the land is used for farming, mainly arable, but {Landwade Hall Farm}has sheep and cattle, including rare breeds. There is some industry in the area. There is a big scrap works near Snailwell. Of particular interest is the unique{"burning tunnel"}built to dispose of railway carriages about 30 years old, the construction of which included blue asbestos, now known to be a health hazard. There is also an important "stud farm" at Exning. There are two houses of historic interest:{Landwade Hall and Fordham {Abbey.}Both of these have replaced older buildings. There are two main roads both with regular but infrequent bus services. A railway line carries freight and passengers from Harwich to the North.
